Yes in many parts of our country,people are more familiar with this type of chanting. “Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare, Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare” No problem if the people in community are chanting the above way, they are chanting Lord’s Holy Name, They will get the benefit. But, as far as we are concerned, Those who are practicing Krishna Consciousness and followers of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. Chaitanya Mahaprabhu recommended everyone to Chant in following manner. Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare. There were some restrictions of chanting of this mantra by brahamanas to local people. So Chaitanya Mahaprabhu recommended all to Chant The Hare Krishna Maha-Mantra in the following way and that is how all ISKCON devotees chant. Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare. Hare Krishna.

Hari om , you are asking a question as to : “Can I chant Hare Krishna mantra like this?.” As long as you are chanting the Lord’s name , it is immaterial whether you start from left to right or from right to left. “Hare rama hare rama rama rama hare hare, hare krishna hare krishna krishna krishna hare hare”.“Ithi sodasakam naamnaam kali kalmasa naasanam, naathah paratharopaaya sarva vaedaeshu drusyathae”.“Haraer naama haraer naama haraer naamaiva kaevalam, kalau naastyaeva naastyaeva naastyaeva gathir anyadhaa”.“Siva naamaiva samsaara mahaa rogaika syaamakam nanyath samsaara rogasya syaamakam drusyathae mayaa”.Vrutthi heenam manah kruthwaa kshaetrajnam paramaathmani, yaekeekruthya vimuchyaetha yogoyam mukhya vuchyathae”.“Yadaa sarvaani bhuthaani samaadhisto na pasyathi , yaekeebhuutha paraenaasau thadhaa bhavathi kaevalaha”.“Daehaabhimaana paasaena chiram baddhosi puthraka, bodhoham jnaana khadgaena thannikruthya sukheebhava”.“Sarvabhuuthaeshu chaathmaanam sarvabhuuthaani chaathmani, samam pasyannathmayajee swaaraajyamadhigachhathi”.“Yomaam pasyathi sarvatra sarvancha mayi pasyathi, thasyaaham na pranasyaami sa cha mae na pranasyathi”.“Sarvaetra sukhinassanthu sarvae santhu niraamayaa, sarvae bhadraani pasyanthu maa kaschid duhkha maapnuyaath”.By chanting Rama , Krishna or Siva or any other name of the Lord , people will attain moksham & they will be free from grief & there is no doubt about this. Hari om.

In my view, the way you want to chant is the proper way of chanting. That is how it has been handed over to us traditionally. Shri Rama avatar is prior to that of Shri Krishna in the chronological order. If you argue that both are one and the same avatars of Vishnu, then you can chant any way you like. There is no harm in that. In the above mantra, Shri Krishna was introduced in the first line and Shri Rama was pushed to the second line, by Iskcon, since they give preference to Shri Krishna over all the other gods and consider him to be the Supreme godhead. As per tradition and chronology, Shri Rama occupies the first line and Shri Krishna comes next. The mantra is effective whichever you chant it.

As per Gita press Gorakhpur the shodash naam mahamantra has “Hare Ram ” first, but in Gaudiya Vaishnava tradition Shri Chaitanya dev reversed the mantra and started to chant “hare krishna” first . Many suggest that like all mantras mahamantra also had certain rules and regulations for chanting such as cleanliness of place , purity of pronounciation etc. And Chaitanya dev wanted to introduce the musical chanting or Kirtan form so that people could invest time in chanting Harinaam instead of just keeping busy in exterior cleanliness etc..so he just reversed the mantra in order to shift the focus of people from “chanting with fear” to “chanting with love and ecstasy” and thankfully he succeeded in doing it beyond doubt.

Before Kalyug, this Mantra was starting from Hare Rama Hare Rama…. In Kalyug, it should start from Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna.. but yes chanting is utmost important. Chant this Mantra while sittting, standing, walking, working…at any time anywhere and see the magic. God bless you!
Of course. Imagine if you were to meet a saint chanting the very same mantra. How would you know whether it starts with Hare Krishna or Hare Rama. Chanting is important!

According to second verse of shikshashtakam There is potency in chanting Holy names of the Lord. So from that point of view the sequence doesn't matter.However it should be noted that Bhakti is practised under the guidance of spiritual master who is coming in the line of disciple succession. It was this Hare Krishna Maha Mantra that was given to us by Chaitanya Mahaprabhu Hindi 15 century and the mantra is being specified in many upanishads. Acharyas have also expound on The divine realizations that they experience within the Maha Mantra. So if you have chosen the devotional School under tree of Brahma Madhva Gaudiya Line- It is better to follow the same text books.However, bear in mind that there is absolutely no problem in following the cultural norms of a place where you are.
